question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the code you generate is executable for display. Help me create an animation promotional video code for Arsenal Football Club, requiring the visual representation of the team's players.

checklist.title: Is the Arsenal FC theme and branding accurately implemented?
checklist.description: Check whether the code properly incorporates Arsenal's official colors (red #EF0107, navy blue #063672, white #FFFFFF), logo, and typography. The animation should maintain Arsenal's brand identity throughout. Deduct 5 points if incorrect colors are used, 3 points if the logo is distorted or missing, and 2 points if typography doesn't match Arsenal's official fonts. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are Arsenal players visually represented with accuracy?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether player representations (images, illustrations, or 3D models) are high quality, recognizable, and current (using active squad members). Player names and numbers should be accurate. Score 10 points for detailed, professional player representations; 5 points if players are generic or outdated; 0 points if players are unrecognizable or missing entirely.

checklist.title: Is the animation sequence professionally implemented?
checklist.description: Review the animation framework implementation (CSS animations, Canvas, SVG animations, or WebGL). Check for smooth keyframes, proper easing functions, and synchronized timing. Deduct 3 points for jerky transitions, 4 points for frame rate drops below 30fps, and 3 points if the animation lacks proper sequencing. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the promotional video have a coherent narrative structure?
checklist.description: Assess whether the animation tells a compelling story about Arsenal FC (team achievements, player highlights, upcoming matches, etc.). The narrative should have a clear beginning, middle, and end. Score 10 points for a complete narrative with logical flow; 5 points for basic narrative elements without cohesion; 0 points if the animation lacks any storytelling elements.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as image loading failures, browser compatibility issues, responsive layout problems, etc.) and provide fallback mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Interactive player statistics on hover/click 2. Dynamic camera movements or 3D scene transitions 3. User-controlled playback options or interactive elements). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant animation effects that overlap or conflict 2. Unnecessary code bloat unrelated to the Arsenal promotion 3. Heavy effects that severely impact performance without adding value. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core promotional message is obscured by redundant elements.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating animation logic/assets/control layers), performance optimization techniques, and resource loading strategies. Deduct 5 points if global namespace pollution is found; deduct 5 points if the code lacks comments or documentation; deduct 5 points if resources aren't properly optimized for web delivery. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Arsenal's brand guidelines implementation 2) Proper visual hierarchy and focal points 3) Professional motion design principles (ease-in/out, proper timing). Deduct 3 points for each inconsistent visual element, 5 points for poor composition or framing, and 5 points for amateur motion design. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the animation performs well across devices: 1) Consistent frame rate (60fps target) 2) Smooth transitions between scenes 3) Appropriate loading indicators and initialization. Deduct 5 points for stuttering animations, 3 points for long unoptimized loading times, and 5 points for lack of responsiveness across different screen sizes. The full score is 10 points.
